definition: to complain bitterly
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
injustice/grievance/wrong
old variant of 冤[yuan1]
variant of 叫[jiao4]
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
surname Qu
bent/to feel wronged

sentences.english: Justice was never done but some one complained.
sentences.chinese: 每一次伸张正义都会有人鸣冤叫屈。

definition: to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
to cry out a grievance
to appeal for justice/to demand redress for a grievance
to right wrongs/to redress an injustice
feel wronged
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
to denounce
to debate/to refute
see 打抱不平[da3 bao4 bu4 ping2]
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
to absolve sb from guilt/to exonerate/to exculpate
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
wronged/to suffer false accusations
